title: Leidos working with NASCAR on Artemis lunar rover
summary: Leidos is working with the racing company NASCAR to develop a lunar rover they will offer for an upcoming NASA competition.

title: Ukraine’s lessons for military space
summary: Ongoing fighting in Ukraine continues to underscore the importance of combining military, civil and commercial space capabilities.

title: Aerospace CEO: More startups seek DoD work amid cash crunch
summary: Aerospace Corp.’s commercial space office, established to facilitate connections between startups and government technology buyers, is seeing a surge in activity.

title: From Galileo to the Lunar Gateway: Mapping Italy’s Growing Space Industry
summary: Today, Italy plays a vital role in space missions and activities worldwide, far more so than is often acknowledged. Italy boasts the second-greatest number of assets in orbit among European nations, and it is an essential contributor to European Space Agency (ESA) and NASA missions.

title: NASA warns of near-term cost growth on Mars Sample Return
summary: COLORADO SPRINGS — NASA’s effort to return samples from Mars could require $250 million more than currently planned over the next two years, putting more pressure on the agency’s overall […]

title: Space Forge reveals plans for U.S. manufacturing
summary: Space Forge announced plans April 19 to expand its U.S. presence to include manufacturing.

title: Space Force in wait-and-see mode as ULA continues to investigate upper-stage anomaly
summary: The head of the U.S. Space Force launch program, Maj. Gen. Stephen Purdy, said he has been briefed by United Launch Alliance on an anomaly experienced last month during testing of the Centaur upper stage of ULA’s new rocket Vulcan Centaur.

title: NRO seeks innovative electro-optics
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is casting a wide net in its latest bid for commercial Earth observation.

title: SpaceX Launches Upgraded Starlink Satellites After Issues with First Batch
summary: SpaceX launched its second batch of upgraded Starlink satellites after some of the first version 2 (v2) buses deorbited earlier than planned. Liftoff aboard a Falcon 9 rocket occurred April 19 at 10:31 AM EDT (14:31 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.

title: Lower space company price tags pave the way to more acquisitions
summary: A drop in space company valuations could open the door to more transactions in the industry, according to an April 17 Space Symposium panel on the outlook for deals, as long as they can navigate increasing regulatory scrutiny.
